title: How many German soldiers died in the Battle of Stalingrad? - Quora

response.answer_text: This question itself poses a separate question. This is the question of what constitutes the definition of the Battle of StalinGrad. Do you mean only the fighting within the city of Stalingrad, or do you mean the campaigns of Army Group B from late 1942 up to the capture of Rostov in February 1943? Either, or a combination of the two, are themselves problems of definition. Also, it is, in my humble opinion (IMHO) a mistake to view Army Group B's activities in isolation from both the concurrent battles of Army Group Centre and Army Group A. I will edit and extend this answer tomorrow when I have access to my desktop computer.
I have seen several different figures ranging from about 250,000 to 500,000 dead German soldiers within the Stalingrad area that I have defined in my comment below. Howard Lederman
